extras: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?><metadata><field name="disclosure">www.digitalpreservation.gov/formats/fdd/</field><field name="documentation">http://desktop.arcgis.com/en/desktop/latest/manage-data/raster-and-images/world-files-for-raster-datasets.htm, http://www.kralidis.ca/gis/worldfile.htm, http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_file, http://wiki.gis.com/wiki/index.php/World_file</field><field name="filenameExtension">tfw, tifw, jgw, jpgw, pgw, bpw, bipw, bmpw, blw, bilw, bqw, bsqw, btw, rcw, rlcw, sdw</field><field name="internetMediaType"></field><field name="pronomPUID"></field></metadata>
description: A simple text file developed for use by ESRI GIS applications and used by other GIS applications for aligning images with other georeferenced images and data.  A world file establishes, through numeric parameters, an image-to-world transformation that converts the image coordinates to geospatial coordinates.
name: ESRI World File
